name: paper production, woodcontaining, supercalendered | paper, woodcontaining, supercalendered | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11407/documentation

This dataset is anidentical copy of corresponding RER dataset. Supercalendered Paper (SC Paper) is a non-coated (i.e. no coating with a coating material like kaolin or calcium carbonate) type of mechanical paper which means that less than 90% of the fibres are in form of chemical pulp. Like lightweight coated (LWC) paper, it is mainly used for print materials such as magazines and journals that require a higher paper quality than newsprint paper. Usually, this kind of paper mill contains an integrated mechanical pulp production and sometimes also an integrated deinking equipment for recovered paper. Used sulfate pulp is usually produced outside of the paper mill.;;;The main sources for this dataset are several environmental reports from European paper mills (Anjalankoski (2001); Jämsä River Mill (2000); Kotka (2001); Laakirchen (2001); Rauma Mill (2001); Reisholz (2002); Summa Mill (2001)). Further sources are the Finnish EcoData database from KCL (KCL (2002)), the German inventory study about graphical paper (Tiedemann et al. (2000)) and the European IPPC documentation for the paper and pulp industry (European Commission (2000)).;;;References:;;;Anjalankoski (2001) Environmental Statement Anjalankoski Mill 2000. Stora Enso Oyj, Anjalankoski (Finland) as pdf-File under: http://www.storaenso.com/CDAvgn/main/0,,1_-2393-2097-,00.html;;;;Jämsä River Mill (2000) Environmental statement 1999. UPM-Kymmene, Jämsänkoski (Finland) as pdf-File under: http://www.paper.upm-kymmene.com;;Kotka (2001) Environmental Statement 2000. Stora Enso ;Kotka Mill, Kotka (Finland) as pdf-File under: http://www.storaenso.com/CDAvgn/main/0,,1_-2393-2097-,00.html;;;;Laakirchen (2001) Umwelterklärung 2000. SCA Graphic Laakirchen AG, Laa-kirchen (Austria) as pdf-File under: http://www.forestproducts.sca.com/gem/gb/subscribe/publication/environm/pdf/Environ%20laak%20de%2000.pdf;;Rauma Mill (2001) ;Environmental report 2000. UPM-Kymmene, Rauma (Fin-land) as pdf-File under: http://www.paper.upm-kymmene.com;;Reisholz (2002) ;Umwelterklärung 2001Werk Reisholz. StoraEnso Reisholz GmbH, Düsseldorf (Germany) as pdf-File under: http://www.storaenso.com/CDAvgn/main/0,,1_-2394-2102-,00.html;;;Summa Mill (2001) Environmental Statement Summa Mill 2000. Stora ;Enso Newsprint, Hamina (Finland) as pdf-File under: http://www.storaenso.com/CDAvgn/main/0,,1_-2393-2097-,00.html;;;Further References;;European Commission (2000) Integrated Pollution Prevention and Control (IPPC) - Reference Document on Best Available Techniques in the Pulp and Paper Industry. Institute for Prospective Technological Studies, ;Sevilla;;KCL (2002) KCL EcoData - life cycle inventory database. The Finnish Pulp and Paper Research Institute (KCL), Espoo (Finnland);;;Tiedemann A., Böttcher Tiedemann C., Buschardt A., Georgi B., ;Giersberg G., Goosmann G., Gregor H.-D., Mehlhorn B., Modi A., Neitzel ;H., Oels H.-J., Schmitz S. and Suhr M. (2000) Ökobilanzen für graphische Papiere. Texte 22/00. Umweltbundesamt, Berlin

This activity starts with the reception of the raw materials, such as pulpwood and sulfate market pulp.

This dataset represents the European production of SC paper - including wood handling, mechanical pulping and bleaching, deinking of waste paper, paper production, energy production on-site and internal wastewater treatment. A small amount of waste paper input (6.1% of output paper weight) has been included in the amount of pulp. The sorting of this paper and the related by-products have been excluded, since the sorting of unsorted paper takes place in a separate activity.
category: C:Manufacturing/17:Manufacture of paper and paper products/170:Manufacture of paper and paper products/1701:Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data represent the average technology in the late 1990ies and early 2000s. The production volume is valid for 2018
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from several European SC paper producers used as European average data.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography RER. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Based on literature and statistics (see dataset field “Published Source”)
